Intervention: MM-121: 12 mg/kg IV QW Cetuximab: 400 mg/m2 loading dose followed by 200 mg/m2 maintenance IV QW
MM-121: 20 mg/kg IV QW Cetuximab: 400 mg/m2 loading dose followed by 200 mg/m2 maintenance IV QW
Eligibility: History of any secondary active cancer in the last 3 years.
History of severe allergic reactions or contraindications to cetuximab or irinotecan
Results: Dose Escalation: To Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Escalating Doses of the MM-121 Plus Cetuximab and the MM-121 Plus Cetuximab Plus Irinotecan Combination

To establish the safety of escalating doses of MM-121 in combination with cetuximab or in combination with cetuximab and irinotecan in order to determine the recommended phase 2 dose.. Dose-escalation conducted using standard 3+3 model to determine maximum tolerated dose. Reports of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) were assessed to determine the MTD.
Time frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 48.1 weeks
Arm/Group Description: MM-121: 12 mg/kg IV QW Cetuximab: 400 mg/m2 loading dose followed by 200 mg/m2 maintenance IV QW
Unit of Measure: participants reporting DLTs  1
Arm/Group Description: MM-121: 20 mg/kg IV QW Cetuximab: 400 mg/m2 loading dose followed by 200 mg/m2 maintenance IV QW
Unit of Measure: participants reporting DLTs  0
